text:
I am currently in an engineering school, majoring in biomedical. At first, I didn't want to be an engineer at all, I wanted to be a doctor, a dentist to be exact. But when I saw my friend, one year older than me, failing the first year exam, I knew I wouldn't be able to suceed. I was afraid to be unable to work a full year without doing anything else.
So, I think about other options in the medical field. I was a little bit interested in computer science (I was in informatic option) and I conviced myself that ingineer wasn't so bad. My father is an engineer, so his experience helped me a lot to saw engineers in a better way. I searched for different engineering schools and I found ESIR which has not just computer science but also biomedical. It was the perfect compromise between my two ideas.
Last year, I had to chose between biomedical and computer science, I decided to chose the biomedical way which combine biomedical science with computer science. I discovered the work of biomedical engineers during my internship. It is extremely intersting, it is a link between computer and medecine which allows doctors to do thing that they couldn't do without computers and programming (in surgery for example).
Finally, all those experiences lead me to become a biomedical engineer and even if engineering studies are not easy, I am happy of my decision.
Alex Dupont
